page.title: 10ROSLIN GLEN NEAR PENICUIK
page.content: At one time this was a flourishing coal mining area. There was a gunpowder factory in Roslin Glen which made explosives for the mines and ammunition. Roslin Glen was chosen because it was a secluded wooded area with running water. The buildings (which can still be seen) were set into the hillside and spread over a large area in case of accidents. The workers used brass hammers and nails to prevent sparks which might cause an explosion. Despite these precautions there were a few accidents. The gunpowder was transported by rail to Leith Docks.In 1926 the factory was taken over by I.C.I. When the area around Roslin started to subside (due to the mining) the factory moved to Ardeer in the west of Scotland. Roslin Glen has now been turned into a country park.
